articles.title: Adobe Firefly Image 5 brings support for layers, will let creators make custom models
articles.summary: Adobe said on Tuesday that it is launching the latest iteration of its image generation model, Firefly Image 5.  The company is also adding features to the Firefly website, support for more third-part.
articles.content: Adobe said on Tuesday that it is launching the latest iteration of its image generation model, Firefly Image 5. The company is also adding features to the Firefly website, support for more third-party models, and the ability to generate speech and soundtracks.
articles.author: Ivan Mehta

articles.title: “We will never build a sex robot,” says Mustafa Suleyman
articles.summary: Mustafa Suleyman, CEO of Microsoft AI, is trying to walk a fine line.  On the one hand, he thinks that the industry is taking AI in a dangerous direction by building chatbots that present as human: He.
articles.content: Mustafa Suleyman, CEO of Microsoft AI, is trying to walk a fine line. On the one hand, he thinks that the industry is taking AI in a dangerous direction by building chatbots that present as human: He worries that people will be tricked into seeing life instead of lifelike behavior. articles.title: PayPal partners with OpenAI to let users pay for their shopping within ChatGPT
articles.summary: Paypal said on Tuesday that it is adopting a protocol in combination with OpenAI's "Instant Checkout" feature to let users pay for their shopping directly within ChatGPT, starting in 2026.

articles.title: Oxford spinout RADiCAIT uses AI to make diagnostic imaging more affordable and accessible — catch it at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
articles.summary: “What we really do is we took the most constrained, complex, and costly medical imaging solution in radiology, and we supplanted it with what is the most accessible, simple and affordable, which is CT.
articles.content: “What we really do is we took the most constrained, complex, and costly medical imaging solution in radiology, and we supplanted it with what is the most accessible, simple and affordable, which is CT,” Sean Walsh, RADiCAIT’s CEO told TechCrunch.
